security_framework.name: ElevenLabs Tools Security Framework
security_framework.description: Comprehensive security guidelines for MCP server integrations and tool management

least_privilege.name: Principle of Least Privilege
least_privilege.description: Grant minimum permissions necessary for functionality
implementation: Create dedicated service accounts with limited permissions
Use read-only database users when possible
Restrict API key scopes to required operations

examples.database_access: Use SELECT-only permissions for reporting tools
examples.api_integrations: Limit OAuth scopes to specific resources
examples.file_storage: Grant access only to specific buckets/folders

defense_in_depth.name: Defense in Depth
layers: Data encryption (at rest and in transit)

zero_trust.name: Zero Trust Architecture
principles: Verify every request regardless of source
Monitor and log all access attempts

authentication_security.name: Authentication Security Guidelines
authentication_security.description: Best practices for secure authentication in tool integrations

generation: Use different keys for different environments
Generate unique keys for each integration
storage: Store in secure secret management system
Never hardcode in source code or configuration files
Use environment variables or secure vaults
Encrypt at rest with strong encryption algorithms
rotation: Monitor for failed authentication after rotation
monitoring: Track key usage across different integrations

client_configuration: Use PKCE (Proof Key for Code Exchange) for public clients
Use state parameter to prevent CSRF attacks
Validate issuer and audience in tokens
token_management: Revoke tokens when no longer needed
scope_management: Regularly audit and review granted permissions

implementation: Support multiple MFA methods (TOTP, SMS, hardware keys)
Provide clear setup instructions for users
bypass_prevention: No MFA bypass for privileged operations
Log all MFA events and failures
Implement account lockout after repeated failures

authorization_security.name: Authorization Security Guidelines
authorization_security.description: Access control and permission management best practices

role_design: Create specific roles for different functions
assignment: Assign roles based on job function
Implement approval workflow for role changes
Automatic role expiration for temporary access

policy_design: Audit trail for all approval decisions

data_protection.name: Data Protection Guidelines
data_protection.description: Protecting sensitive data in tool integrations and workflows

confidential.protection_level: Strong access controls, encryption, and monitoring

restricted.description: Highly sensitive information requiring special handling
restricted.protection_level: Maximum security controls and compliance requirements

data_at_rest: Use AES-256 or equivalent strong encryption
Secure key management with regular rotation
Encrypt database columns containing sensitive data
data_in_transit: Enforce TLS 1.3 or higher for all communications
Use certificate pinning for critical connections
key_management: Use hardware security modules (HSMs) when possible
Regular key audits and compliance checks

gdpr_requirements: Implement data subject rights (access, rectification, erasure)
Privacy by design in all integrations

network_security.name: Network Security Guidelines
network_security.description: Secure network communication and infrastructure protection

https_enforcement: Use HTTPS for all external communications
Disable insecure protocols (HTTP, older TLS versions)
certificate_management: Use certificates from trusted Certificate Authorities
Implement certificate pinning for critical services

firewall_configuration: Default deny policy for all traffic
Whitelist only necessary ports and protocols
ddos_protection: Implement rate limiting at multiple layers

monitoring_and_logging.name: Security Monitoring and Logging
monitoring_and_logging.description: Comprehensive monitoring and incident detection capabilities

compliance_requirements.name: Compliance and Regulatory Requirements
compliance_requirements.description: Meeting regulatory and industry compliance standards

incident_response.name: Security Incident Response Procedures
incident_response.description: Procedures for handling security incidents and breaches

critical.description: Immediate threat to business operations or data

high.description: Significant security impact requiring urgent attention
